articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Egyptian Businessman
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Egyptian Businessman 
Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Sunday received Naguib Sawiris, chairman and CEO of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there was Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il received a gift from him. 
					
					 He thanked him for the gift and warmly welcomed his DPRK visit taking place at a time when Orascom's investment is making successful progress in different fields of the DPRK, including tele-communications. 
					
					 He had a cordial talk with him.
					
					 After receiving him, Kim Jong Il hosted a dinner for him.

articles.title: Funeral Service for Pak Jong Sun Held
articles.content:
Funeral Service for Pak Jong Sun Held
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- A state funeral service for Pak Jong Sun, alternate member of the Political Bureau and first vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, took place in Pyongyang on Monday.
					 Present at a ceremony for the departure of funeral procession were Presidium members, members and alternate members of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and members of the State Funeral Committee and the bereaved family.
					
					 Senior party, army and state officials, members of the SFC and the bereaved family observed a moment silence in memory of the late.
					
					 The coffin was carried out of the hall.
					
					 Deep condolences were expressed by citizens along streets where the hearse passed.
					
					 A ceremony for bidding last farewell to the deceased took place at the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, made a funeral address there.
					
					 Pak Jong Sun enjoyed love and respect of the Party members and other people for his intense loyalty to the Party and the revolution, devoted service for the country and the people and steadfast principle and simple honesty, the speaker noted.
					
					 Pak's death is a great loss to the WPK and the Korean people, he said, adding that his feats for the Party and the revolution, the country and the people will remain long.
					
					 The remains of the deceased were buried.
					
					 Laid before his grave was a wreath from leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Placed there were wreaths from the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, the Cabinet of the DPRK and other different units.
					
					 The participants paid a silent tribute to the memory of the late Pak Jong Sun.

articles.title: Day of India Observed
articles.content:
Day of India Observed
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- A film show took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club here on Monday to mark the Day of the Republic of India.
					 Present on invitation at the show were Ambassador Pratap Singh and staff members of the Indian embassy.
					
					 Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the DPRK-India Friendship Association, members of the Association and working people in the city of Pyongyang were on hand.
					
					  They watched an Indian feature film.

articles.title: Sports Contest of Officials Opened
articles.content:
Sports Contest of Officials Opened
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The 16th sports contest of officials of national institutions for Paektusan Prize opened in the DPRK with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Monday.
					It is to celebrate February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The contest consists of eleven events including basketball, volleyball, table tennis, Taekwon-Do, shooting, collective running and seesaw.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Vice-Premier Kang Nung Su, Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of ministries, national institutions and other organs concerned, players and working people in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, made an opening address there.

articles.title: New Glass Bottle Factory Goes Operational
articles.content:
New Glass Bottle Factory Goes Operational 
  Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The workers of the factory and working people in Nampho City completed the construction of a modern glass bottle factory in a matter of less than one year. It went operational to help improve the standard of people's living. 
					 All its production processes ranging from raw material feeding to packing and forwarding are streamlined.
					
					 It is capable of producing tens of millions of glass bottles for diverse uses a year. It has a good prospect of its development as it depends on raw materials found in abundance in the country including white silica, feldspar and silica sand. 
					
					 Min Kwang Yong, 47, who is manager of the Nampho Glass Bottle Factory, said that he had a plan to boost the production by lifting its modernization to a higher level and improving the level of producers' technical skills.

articles.title: Eel Production on Increase
articles.content:
Eel Production on Increase
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Eel production is on the increase at the Taedonggang Eel Breeding Farm in the DPRK.
					 Its Manager Sin Kwang Ho, 54, said that his farm produced dozens of tons of more eel per hectare last year than the previous year.
					
					 The farm introduced such cutting-edge technique as breeding fish in ponds after mixing cold water with warm water and taking measures for preventing diseases, thus keeping 90 percent of the fish on the farm alive and raising the rate of its growth 11. 2 percent.
					
					 It also solved the problem of feed for eel in a unique manner.
					
					 The quality of eel bred on the farm is very good as it bans the use of any chemical substance.
					
					 It has ample conditions for fish breeding, including a modern feed processing room, indoor fish ponds, a combined control panel and a lab.
					
					 It succeeded in placing the water quality control on a CNC basis. All its production processes are put on a scientific and intensive basis.
					
					 Catering facilities are provided with eel produced by the farm.

articles.title: Raising of Mud Snail for Farming Brisk
articles.content:
Raising of Mud Snail for Farming Brisk
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Ever-growing attention is paid to raising mud snails in the field of agriculture in the DPRK.
					 This is clear from the fact that the area of paddy fields where mud snails are used for rice cultivation swelled more than eight times last year as compared with that in the previous year, taking the country as a whole.
					
					 A facility for breeding mud snails covering 15,000 square meters sprang up in Pyongyang. 
					
					 More than 150 facilities for mud snail raising were built in South Hwanghae Province, the nation's leading granary.
					
					  Farms in North Phyongan Province are directing efforts to the work to place the mud snail breeding on a scientific and technological basis. 
					
					 Yomju County, in particular, built grounds for raising mud snails, increasing the production of young mud snails to fulfil its plan for applying those snails to 1,000 hectares of paddy fields. The drive to use mud snails for farming to suit features of local areas is also making brisk headway on farms in North Hwanghae, Kangwon and South Hamgyong provinces and other areas.

articles.title: 82,000 Take Part in March of 250-Mile Journey
articles.content:
82,000 Take Part in March of 250-Mile Journey
Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- More than 82,000 school youth and children took part in the march of the 250-mile Journey for National Liberation in the new century.
					 January 22 this year marks 86 years since President Kim Il Sung started the journey. 
					
					 Every year a great number of school youth and children make study tour of the course on this occasion through which they learn his immortal revolutionary exploits and train themselves ideologically, morally and physically.
					
					 The march has been traditionalized since 1975.
					
					 The number of marchers increased to thousands on the occasions of the 75th and 85th anniversaries of the journey and other major occasions.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues of the President in Kaechon, Hyangsan, Kanggye, Phophyong and other places. They also visited revolutionary sites such as the Soson Hostel, Kanggye Inn and Phophyong Revolutionary Site.

articles.title: Detente on Korean Peninsula Urged--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Detente on Korean Peninsula Urged--Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Detente on the Korean Peninsula is essential for peace in Northeast Asia, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined article.
					 To defend peace from a war on the Korean Peninsula is of very importance in preserving peace of Northeast Asia, the article says, adding:
					
					 The Korean Peninsula has turned into a region fraught with highest tension and biggest danger of war worldwide. Such developments badly affect peace in Northeast Asia. 
					
					 Increased danger of military clash on the peninsula strains the situation of Northeast Asia but atmosphere of peace there brings stability to the region.
					
					 One of the important problems for ensuring peace on the peninsula is to see into the essence of the U.S. policy for aggression on Korea and take a principled stand toward it.
					
					 The U.S. has justified this policy, asserting that it is to cope with "military threat" from the DPRK. But, historically the latter has never posed threat to the security of the former.
					
					 Its talk about non-existent "military threat" is just for a pretext to perpetuate its military occupation of south Korea and reinforce its aggression armed forces around the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. strategy is to put whole Korea under its control by military strength and, with it as a springboard, dominate Northeast Asia and, furthermore, Eurasia.
					
					 The more loudly the U.S. talk about "military threat" from the DPRK, the more serious danger of war will grow on the Korean Peninsula and, accordingly, the situation of Northeast Asia and the Asia-Pacific region will be strained.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to preserve peace and security in Northeast Asia and, furthermore, contribute to achieving global peace, security and development, the article concludes.

articles.title: Increased Speed of Onward March for Great Surge Called for
articles.content:
Increased Speed of Onward March for Great Surge Called for 
Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- It is necessary for all service personnel and people to increase the speed of the onward march for a great surge at the maximum, loudly singing the song "Way of Victory" under the leadership of the great party. 
					 This call is made by Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as a great event in human history and greeting the centenary of Kim Il Sung's Korea with fresh victory.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The song reverberating all over the country sounds like a thunderclap as it encourages all service personnel and people to win victories in sky-high spirit and a march calling on them to maximize the speed of their march for a great surge. 
					
					 This song serves as a march for uninterrupted revolution for their final victory. 
					
					 They are the dignified service personnel and people who have adorned the red flag of revolution unfurled in Mt. Paektu with victories only, making long journeys under the leadership of the President and the party. 
					
					 Final victory entirely hinges on the on-going drive. 
					
					 World shaking events including the Huichon speed with which a great leap forward is being made in different work sites and the miracle wrought in the reclamation of the Taegyedo tideland strikingly demonstrate the mental power of the Korean people who devotedly carry through the party policies in the spirit that when the great general Kim Jong Il is determined, they can do anything.
					
					 They can say that the DPRK has laid all the politico-ideological, military, economic and technological foundations for translating the long-cherished ideal of building a thriving nation into reality in all fields. 
					
					 Only when they increase the speed of the onward march for a great surge, not slackening the present elated spirit, will they see the appearance of a thriving socialist nation of Juche, a land of bliss, where the desire of the President has come true. Then it will shed its rays all over the world.

articles.title: Rev. Han Sang Ryol Sentenced to Prison Term in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rev. Han Sang Ryol Sentenced to Prison Term in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Court sentenced Rev. Han Sang Ryol to five years in prison and five-year suspension of qualifications on Jan. 21, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					 The south Korean authorities arrested him as soon as he crossed Panmunjom at north-south borderline after visiting the DPRK last year. They persecuted him long and at last sentenced him to severe punishment.  
					
					 The court also sentenced Co-representative Han Chung Mok and several members of the Solidarity for Progress to prison term and other punishment on charges of waging anti-U.S. actions.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Declare Action against Conservative Media
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Declare Action against Conservative Media 
Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- More than 100 civic and public organizations of south Korea declared action against the conservative media, according to south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Jan. 17. 
					 They include the Citizens Federation for Democratic Press and the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society.
					
					 They accused Chosun Ilbo, Choongang Ilbo and Dong-A Ilbo of working hard to mislead the public opinion and violate democracy, being granted special privilege by the authorities.
					
					 The social action for checking privatization of media and expanding impartiality of media grouping 49 media organizations clarified the will to expose misinformation released by the three newspapers. It declared they would launch the movement to boycott the conservative media along with the action to check evil law on media. 
					
					 The Democratic Labor Party, the Democratic Party and other political parties and religious organizations would join the action, the organization said.

articles.title: S. Korean Professors Call for Peaceful Reunification
articles.content:
S. Korean Professors Call for Peaceful Reunification
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- University professors of south Korea accused the "government" of its "strategy of unification through absorption of the north" and called for peaceful reunification, according to Thongil News of south Korea.
					 Prof. Ri Nam Ju at a seminar on Jan. 19 said that "tougher sanctions against the north over denuclearization would naturally increase uneasiness on the Korean Peninsula".
					
					 "One should look forward to the peaceful settlement of the Korean Peninsula issue through the boosted north-south relations and the weakening south Korea-U.S. military alliance", he said.
					
					 Prof. Yang Mu Jin branded the "government's" policy toward the north as failed policy of confrontation and absorption. The "government" claims it is for co-existence and co-prosperity.
					
					 He analyzed that "there is scarce possibility of leading the north to a likely change" among the "government's north policy targets." The "separated access to the north authorities and its inhabitants will result in deepening the animosity to south Korea", he said.
					
					 He urged the need for the "government" to drop the "theory of unification through absorption" and draft a plan for peaceful reunification.

articles.title: US Branded as Wrecker of Peace by Belgian Party
articles.content:
US Branded as Wrecker of Peace by Belgian Party
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Belgium condemned the United States for trying to tighten its military domination in Northeast Asia.
					 The grave incidents in the Korean Peninsula last year show that the U.S. is the mastermind of straining situation and harassing peace and stability, said it in its solidarity letter to the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea on Jan. 17. 
					
					 What is urgent, above all, for peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world is to crush the machination of the U.S. imperialists, the letter said:
					
					 It went on to say:
					
					 The reunification of the Korean Peninsula can be possible only when it is free from interference and threat by the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 This means that the U.S. forces should be withdrawn from south Korea and a peace treaty concluded between the DPRK and the U.S. to put an end to the state of ceasefire.
					
					 We wish the Korean people success in this important struggle for peace of the peninsula and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Support for DPRK's Joint Statement Called for
articles.content:
Support for DPRK's Joint Statement Called for
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Communist Party called upon governments, political parties and organizations of all countries and international organizations and progressives the world over to support the joint statement of government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 The Party in a statement on Jan. 15 said that the high tension on the Korean Peninsula has become a main factor of destabilizing the international situation.
					
					 All peoples desirous of peace against war hope that the DPRK's important proposal for solving the issues between the north and the south of Korea through wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations would come to reality, it said.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Accept Proposal of DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Accept Proposal of DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The Czech, Moravian, Silesian Trade Unions' Association supported the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK in a statement on Jan. 13.
					 The proposal of the DPRK is another important initiative for averting the danger of a war on the Korean Peninsula and realizing the ardent desire of the Korean people for reunification, the statement said. 
					
					 The history proved that confrontation would only spark armed conflict and war, far from solving the issue of the north-south relations, it said. 
					
					 It also showed that if a war breaks out on the peninsula the Korean nation will suffer while foreign forces fish in troubled waters, it added.
					
					 It demanded the south Korean authorities accept the proposal of the DPRK without delay.

articles.title: KFA Urges S. Korean Authorities to Accept DPRK's Proposal
articles.content:
KFA Urges S. Korean Authorities to Accept DPRK's Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The authorities of south Korea should discard their dependence on foreign forces and lend an ear to the call of the Korean people for independence and reunification.
					 The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain made this demand in a statement on Jan. 17.
					
					 The joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK embodies the idea of "By our nation itself", the core of the June 15 joint declaration provided under the far-reaching plan of General Secretary Kim Jong Il for national reunification, the Association said, adding:
					
					 If the south Korean authorities do not accept the proposal of the DPRK, they would face a stern punishment by history as traitors.

articles.title: DPRK Proposal for Dialogue Supported in Tanzania
articles.content:
DPRK Proposal for Dialogue Supported in Tanzania
						
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's proposal for wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south of Korea is patriotic and realistic one.
					 The Tanzanian National Coordinating Committee of the Juche Idea Study Groups and the Tanzania-DPRK Friendship Association said this in a joint statement on Jan. 12.
					
					 We hope that the Korean people's cherished desire to achieve the national reunification independently and peacefully without outsiders' interference would be realized as early as possible, the statement said.

articles.title: Joint Statement of DPRK Hailed Abroad
articles.content:
Joint Statement of DPRK Hailed Abroad
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Edmond Jouve, director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, issued a statement on Jan. 15 supporting the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 The joint statement is the just, timely and patriotic proposal in view of the serious situation on the Korean Peninsula and the aspiration and demand of all Koreans, the statement said.
					
					 It noted that the joint statement is arousing support and positive sympathy of all Koreans and the peoples of the world.
					
					 It urged the south Korean authorities to unconditionally accept this patriotic and important proposal without delay.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il se reune con presidente de compania egipcia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il se reune con presidente de compania egipcia
Pyongyang, 24 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se reunio el dia 23 con el director general de la Compania de Telecomunicaciones Orascom de Egipto, Naguib Sawiris, de visita en Corea.
					Le acompano Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC.
					
					El Dirigente recibio regalo que le dirigiera el visitante.
					
					Tras agradecerlo y darle calurosa bienvenida a Naguib Sawiris por su visita a nuestro pais cuando se realizan con exito las inversiones de su compania sobre varias esferas de Corea, incluidas las comunicaciones, el Dirigente departio con el en un ambiente cordial.
					
					Terminada la audiencia, el Dirigente ofrecio una cena en honor del huesped.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Pak Jong Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Pak Jong Sun
Pyongyang, 24 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, envio el dia 23 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Pak Jong Sun, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y primer subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Fallecio Pak Jong Sun
articles.content:
Fallecio Pak Jong Sun 
						
Pyongyang, 24 de enero (ATCC) -- Pak Jong Sun, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y primer subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, fallecio a la una del 22 de enero del 100 (2011) de la Era Juche a causa de cancer pulmonar.
					  El nacio el dia primero de julio de 1928 en una familia campesina pobre del distrito de Phyongwon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					 Despues de la liberacion de la patria, crecio como competente funcionario en el regazo del partido y el lider y trabajo durante mucho tiempo en los cargos importantes del CC del PTC y del partido local.
					
					  Desde 1962, el trabajo de instructor, jefe de seccion, subjefe y primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC y lucho abnegadamente por el fortalecimiento de las filas del partido y la revolucion y por la victoria de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					  Desde 2010, trabajo de miembro del CC del PTC y miembro suplente del BP del CC del Partido.
					
					  Recibio la Orden Kim Il Sung, maxima distincion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase y otras condecoraciones estatales por sus proezas excelentes realizadas ante el partido y la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					Ese dia, se publico la esquela mortuoria en nombre del CC del PTC.
					
					La nota senala que Pak Jong Sun lucho valientemente con el arma en la mano por la victoria de la Guerra de la Liberacion de la Patria contra la agresion armada de los imperialistas norteamericanos.
					
					Al asumir en el periodo de la construccion socialista varios cargos en el CC del PTC y organizacion del partido local, contribuyo a fortalecer el PTC y llamar con vigor a los militantes del partido y otros trabajadores a cumplir las lineas y politicas del partido, destaca.
					
					El CC del PTC dio a conocer que los funerales del difunto Pak se realizaran de caracter nacional, y compuso la comision funeraria estatal presidida por Kim Kuk Thae e integrada por Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho y otros 43 miembros.
					
					Esta comision funeraria anuncio que el feretro del difunto reposa en el Club de Sojang en el municipio de Pothong de la ciudad de Pyongyang, acogera a los visitantes desde las 10 hasta las 18 del dia 23 y saldra de este lugar a las 8 del dia 24.

articles.title: Tienen lugar los funerales de difunto Pak Jong Sun
articles.content:
Tienen lugar los funerales de difunto Pak Jong Sun
Pyongyang, 24 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 24 en esta capital con honores del Estado los funerales del difunto Pak Jong Sun, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y primer subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					En la ceremonia de salida del feretro participaron los miembros del Presidium del Buro Politico (BP) del CC del PTC, miembros y miembros suplentes del BP del CC del PTC, los integrantes del Comite Funerario Estatal y los familiares del difunto.
					
					Los funcionarios directivos del partido, el ejercito y el Estado, los miembros del Comite Funerario Estatal y los familiares del difunto guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto Pak.
					
					Partio el feretro del difunto.
					
					El carro que lo llevaba levanto a su paso por las avenidas una profunda estela de pesar.
					
					Se efectuo la ceremonia de despedida en el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos.
					
					Kim Ki Nam, miembro del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, destaco en el discurso de la ocasion que Pak Jong Sun era adorado y respetado por los militantes del partido y el pueblo por su fidelidad infinita al partido y la revolucion, espiritu de servir abnegadamente por la patria y el pueblo, firmes principios revolucionarios y caracter recto.
					
					El deceso de Pak es una gran perdida para el PTC y el pueblo coreano, subrayo y anadio que quedaran eternamente los meritos realizados por el ante el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					Acto seguido, fueron enterrados los restos mortales del difunto.
					
					Fue depositada la ofrenda floral enviada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Tambien fueron colocadas las ofrendas florales del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y otras unidades.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto.

articles.title: Tiene lugar proyeccion filmica por el Dia de Republica de la India
articles.content:
Tiene lugar proyeccion filmica por el Dia de Republica de la India
  Pyongyang, 24 de enero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 24 en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang la proyeccion filmica dedicada al dia de la Republica de la India.
					  A la ocasion fueron invitados el embajador Pratap Singh y otros miembros de la embajada india en Corea.
					
					  Participaron Jon Yong Jin, vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-India, los miembros de esta asociacion y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					  Los reunidos vieron una pelicula india.
